page.title: 12ROYALTY IN RICHMOND PARK
page.content: Since 1963,{Princess Alexandra}and her husband Mr.Angus Ogilvie have lived at Thatched House Lodge in Richmond Park,near Ham Gate. It is a handsome 18th.Century house with tall chimneys,not very large.Princess Alexandra is a serving member of the English Royal Family. She is a cousin of the Queen and both she and the Queen are grandchildren of King George V. She chose to marry a commoner and she has a son and a daughter. Thatched House Lodge where they live gets its name from the thatched summerhouse in the grounds,built by Walpole in 1727. There is strong security surrounding the Princess.The Kingston Constabulary have a permanent police post next door and watch all visitors as they arrive.The Princess has a bodyguard,chauffer,cook and gardener.
